data.enText: a long channel dug at the side of a field or road, to hold or take away water
to get rid of sth/sb because you no longer want or need it/them

data.chText: 新的道路建设计划已废弃。
data.enText: The new road building programme has been ditched.

data.chText: 使（飞机）在海上紧急降落；（在海上）迫降
data.enText: if a pilot ditches an aircraft, or if it ditches , it lands in the sea in an emergency

means: 使(飞机)在海上紧急降落

ex.enText: There's something wrong with the drains.

ex.chText: 他没时间修理堵塞的排水管。
ex.enText: He has no time to repair the blocked drain.

synonyms.bx: 尤指挖于地上供水流通的沟渠。

ex.enText: He fell into the ditch in the dark.

ex.chText: 路边的沟里积了些雨水。
ex.enText: There is some rainwater in the ditch along the side of the road.

synonyms.bx: 指挖于田边、路边等处用于蓄水或排水的沟。

tr: a long narrow excavation in the earth
cut a trench in, as for drainage
example: ditch the land to drain it

tr: make an emergency landing on water
sever all ties with, usually unceremoniously or irresponsibly
example: The company dumped him after many years of service
She dumped her boyfriend when she fell in love with a rich man

value.def: A ditch is a long narrow channel cut into the ground at the side of a road or field.
If you ditch something that you have or are responsible for, you abandon it or get rid of it, because you no longer want it.

example.ex: I decided to ditch the sofa bed.
Unpopular policies such as unilateral disarmament were ditched.
example.tran: 诸如单边裁军之类不得人心的政策已被废除了。

value.def: If someone ditches someone, they end a relationship with that person.

example.ex: I can't bring myself to ditch him and start again.
example.tran: 我不忍心蹬掉他再觅新欢。

value.def: If a pilot ditches an aircraft or if it ditches, the pilot makes an emergency landing.

example.ex: One American pilot was forced to ditch his jet in the Gulf...
example.tran: 一位美国飞行员被迫将喷气式飞机紧急迫降在波斯湾上。

example.ex: A survivor was knocked unconscious when the helicopter ditched.
example.tran: 在直升机紧急迫降时，一名幸存者被撞昏过去。
